adm:managed-object.name: dictionary-password-validator
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis:
The
is used to determine whether a proposed password is acceptable based on whether the given password value appears in a provided dictionary file.

adm:property.name: dictionary-file
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
Specifies the path to the file containing a list of words that may not be used as passwords. It should be formatted with one word per line. The value may be an absolute path, or a path that is relative to the
instance root.

adm:property.name: case-sensitive-validation
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether this password validator should treat password characters in a case-sensitive manner.
adm:property.adm:description: Indicates whether this password validator should treat password characters in a case-sensitive manner. A value of false indicates that any differences in capitalization should be ignored when looking for consecutive characters in the password. A value of true indicates that a character should only be considered repeating if all consecutive occurrences use the same capitalization.

adm:property.name: test-reversed-password
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether this password validator should test the reversed value of the provided password as well as the order in which it was given.
